summary.p: This critical edition and translation is a work in progress.

standOff.note: On kalai māṉ... maṭam māṉ, cf. KT272, maṭam māṉ... kalai, which UVS and TVG interpret as a female deer and a male stag.
On pariyal vāḻiyō neñcē, cf. NA121. This reading is an almost direct parallel to NA121.7 as found in Turaicāmi Piḷḷai's edition (ET in Wilden 2008).

The KKms witness does not include this poem. There is a gap in the manuscript, represented by a series of dots over three lines. The print edition includes five poems in this space. As a footnote in the print edition, Vaiyapuripiḷḷai writes: īṇṭu 79,80 eṉṟu iraṇṭu eṇṇukkuriya ēṭu vīṭuṟṟatu: ātaliṉ viṣayattoṭarpiṉṟu' eṉpatu toṉṉūl - nilayap pirati.

This poem only appears in the palm-leaf manuscript of the TNV, UVSL950. In the paper copy and all printed editions it does not appear, and it is not mentioned in any notes. U. Ve. Sa. writes that he consulted the palm-leaf when editing the text, so I am not sure if this was simply an oversight or a conscious decision. In the KK it is attributed to the Poruḷiyal. The first line parallels the last line of NA34.
